requirements.summary: Increase overall UI colorfulness across storefront and customer/vendor/admin portals using the existing palette on key surfaces while maintaining strong contrast in light/dark modes and not editing immutable shadcn/ui sources.
acceptanceCriteria: Across Home, Categories, Product, Cart, Checkout, and the Admin/Vendor dashboards, visible accent color usage is increased beyond just the primary CTA buttons (e.g., colored section headers, chips, badges, and subtle tinted card backgrounds).
Text remains readable: no primary/secondary/accent-colored backgrounds have low-contrast foreground text in either light or dark mode.
No shadcn/ui immutable component source files are modified.

file_operations.description: Add a small set of reusable, palette-aligned utility classes for: (1) tinted surfaces for cards/sections in light+dark modes, (2) section header accents, (3) stronger focus-visible rings using existing --ring/primary/secondary/accent tokens, and (4) empty-state container styling with subtle tint + border for better visual richness without sacrificing readability.

Increase colorful palette usage in the header/nav: introduce subtle tinted/gradient header surface treatment, improve nav link hover/focus states, and make the cart count badge styling more intentional and readable in both modes (without changing any files under frontend/src/components/ui).

Enhance active/hover/focus states for bottom navigation using palette accents (primary/secondary/accent), adding clearer visual hierarchy (e.g., active indicator, tinted background on active) while keeping contrast strong.
Apply a subtle palette-tinted global app background treatment (light/dark safe) behind main content so storefront and portal pages feel more colorful without creating noise.

Increase use of palette accents on section headers and key callout surfaces (e.g., 'Shop by Category', 'Hot Deals', 'Featured Products') via tinted header chips/accents and lightly tinted cards while preserving spacing and readability. Keep any user-facing text changes in English.
Make category tiles more colorful via subtle tinted overlays/borders and improved hover/focus styling; ensure category name text remains readable over images in both light and dark modes.

Add palette accents to key product surfaces (image carousel container, pricing highlight, review section header, stock info) using subtle tints/borders and strong focus states for interactive elements; do not modify shadcn/ui component source files.

Improve colorful accents in cart list and order summary (tinted summary card, clearer hover/focus states on product links and quantity controls, more vibrant empty/auth-required states) while maintaining contrast in both modes.
Add subtle tinted backgrounds and palette-accent headers for summary/payment cards, and strengthen focus/hover states for the primary checkout action without reducing usability.
Make admin dashboard stat cards more visually distinct and palette-aligned (tinted icon containers, subtle card tints) and ensure chart styling remains readable in light/dark modes.
Increase palette accents in vendor dashboard (tinted quick actions card, more vibrant secondary action styling, and clearer visual hierarchy) while preserving layout consistency.

requirements.summary: Add subtle gradients and tinted backgrounds using existing Tailwind theme tokens, and make hover/active/focus states more vibrant and usable without creating visual noise.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero/banner areas and category cards show subtle, tasteful color treatment (tints/gradients) that is consistent with the existing palette.
Interactive elements (nav links, cards, product tiles, buttons) have clearer, more colorful hover/focus states than before.
The UI does not become visually noisy: spacing and hierarchy remain clear and consistent.

file_operations.description: Update hero slider to use the more vibrant generated banners and add a subtle palette-aligned gradient/tint overlay plus more vibrant but accessible controls/indicators. Replace banner image references to: frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-banner-1-colorful.dim_1600x600.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-banner-2-colorful.dim_1600x600.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-banner-3-colorful.dim_1600x600.png.

Swap trust badges asset to the more vibrant version and ensure it sits on a tasteful tinted surface for visual richness. Update image reference to: frontend/public/assets/generated/trust-badges-set-colorful.dim_1024x256.png.
Add subtle palette gradients/tints to key callouts (hero adjacency and category area) and enrich hover states on category tiles/cards while keeping layout and hierarchy clear.

Enhance product tile vibrancy: add subtle tinted card backgrounds/borders on hover, improve wishlist button visibility states, and strengthen focus-visible styling for tile interactions while keeping text readable.
Introduce subtle tinted overlays/gradients for category cards and improve hover/active feedback for image tiles and titles using existing palette tokens.

Add a small set of gradient/tint helper utilities (using existing OKLCH theme tokens and alpha) for hero overlays, callout cards, and hover/active states, ensuring consistent behavior in light and dark modes.

requirements.summary: Apply consistent, palette-aligned styling to badges and status indicators (order status, stock/availability, success/error/info) across customer/vendor/admin pages so the same status renders identically everywhere.
acceptanceCriteria: Order status badges/pills use distinct, consistent colors aligned to the theme (e.g., accent/success green, secondary blue, destructive, muted) and are readable.
The same status value appears with the same styling anywhere it is rendered (customer orders, vendor orders, admin orders).

file_operations.description: Create a shared, palette-aligned status styling utility that maps known order statuses and common UI states (success/error/info/warning/muted) to consistent classNames that are readable in light and dark modes.
Add a small reusable component that renders an order status pill/badge using the shared statusStyles mapping to guarantee consistent visuals anywhere order status is shown.
Replace the local getStatusColor/getStatusText logic with the shared OrderStatusBadge and shared status text mapping so order status styling matches vendor/admin pages exactly.
Replace the local getStatusColor/getStatusText logic with the shared OrderStatusBadge to ensure consistent status presentation across portals.

Replace the local getStatusColor/getStatusText logic with the shared OrderStatusBadge so status pills are consistent with customer/vendor pages; ensure the status update control remains usable and visually consistent.
Add consistent availability/status indicators (e.g., 'Out of stock', discount) using the shared status styling conventions so badges/pills are informative and palette-aligned.
Apply shared status styling conventions to stock/availability messaging and promotional badges to keep status semantics consistent and readable across the app.
